intro: Melothria ulei, commonly known as the sour sop or custard apple, is a tropical fruit-bearing plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, hairy leaves and clusters of yellow or green fruits. The fruit has a thick, spiky rind and a creamy, aromatic flesh that is highly valued for its unique flavor. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The plant is also known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers.
